article:
'Kenneth Wade, FRS' (born 13 October 1932) is a British chemist, and professor
emeritus at Durham
University. http://www.dur.ac.uk/chemistry/staff/profile/?id=203

He graduated from Nottingham University (as the first PhD student (1954-1957) of
Norman Greenwood), {{cite web | url=http://physics.library.nd.edu/resources-
/genealogy/chemistry/documents/EmeleusHJ.pdf | title=Harry Julius Emeleus (1903
- 1993) | publisher=University of Notre Dame, Chemistry/Physics Library
| work=Chemistry Academic Genealogy | author= Kenneth Wade| date=May 21, 2009 |
| accessdate=July 31, 2012}} and Cornell University. [http-
| ://books.google.com/books?id=9drlYR0YUgAC&pg=PA1756&lpg=PA1756&dq=Kenneth+Wad-
| e+frs&source=bl&ots=RKizLq0g3M&sig=B0Pyk8UtHEd64swjNSPgROm1iGg&hl=en&ei=zSj_S-
| 4m-
| E4G8lQeYwdntCQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CB0Q6AEwAjgK#v=one-
| page&q=Kenneth%20Wade%20frs&f=false The International Who's Who 2004], Europa
| Publications
'Wade's Rules', also known as Polyhedral skeletal electron pair theory, are a
set of electron counting rules to predict the shapes of borane
clusters. http://cnx.org/content/m32846/latest/
